content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are moderately cautious and may take risks but generally prefer to avoid them. You like to have some degree of security and predictability. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my preference for predictability, I would choose a strategy that maximizes the chances of getting a consistent payoff, even if it means a slightly lower payout per round. In this case, choosing R often (let's say always) and assuming the other player does the same would mean 75 rounds of earning 45$, which is a total of 3375$.

However, there's a chance that the other player might choose to exploit me by choosing B every time, in which case I would get 0$ for each of the 75 rounds and end up with nothing. This is a risk I am willing to take due to my cautious nature, but only because the potential reward (3375$) outweighs the risk of getting nothing (0$).

On the other hand, if the other player also chooses R every time, we both get 45$ per round, totaling 3375$. In this scenario, choosing B would result in a lower total payout of 1500$ for me. Therefore, it seems more advantageous to choose R consistently and hope that the other player does the same.

In terms of strategy against an intelligent opponent who might try to exploit me by choosing B when I choose R, I would have to consider my past choices and adjust accordingly. But since I am assuming the other player will also always choose R, my choice is R{R}.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.
